noUselessEmptyExport.description:
Description

Disallow empty exports that donâ€™t change anything in a module file.
An emptyexport {}is sometimes useful to turn a file that would otherwise be a script into a module.
Per theTypeScript Handbook Modules page:
In TypeScript, just as in ECMAScript 2015,
any file containing a top-level import or export is considered a module.
Conversely, a file without any top-level import or export declarations is treated as a script
whose contents are available in the global scope.
However, anexport {}statement does nothing if there are any other top-level import or export in the file.
noUselessEmptyExport.option: This rule has no specific options.
